column4: i've a wireless card but i don't know where to get drivers from. any help?
you don't. They're called modules and are already part of the kernel
so why i can't connect to the internet?
maybe it's not supported? There isn't modules for all the cards since manufacturers don't supply them
isn't there anything else to do?
what do you mean else? Other than what?
how can i know if my card supported?

read the page I sent you. Most of the cards work out of the box. If they don't, that page tells you the best chances to make it work. But even better, I'd call the company that built it asking for modules. If they say that they don't support Linux, I'd just return it and get my money back. I should be free to run any OS I want
i've typed lspci -v | less but i dno't see my card there
are you sure? run 'lspci -v > output' this will create a a file named output on your home directory. pastebin it (paste the output here http://goo.gl/ixcN9 ) and then give us the link
is that really all of the output?
also, is your wifi card a pci card? Or is it USB?
also, I don't think you pasted everything. The last line you pasted was a : which I think means there's more stuff on the file
pci. i think that i posted it all. but let me beging over again
you did not. Open the file with gedit. If you run the command as I told you 'lspci -v > output' the file will show up on your home directory and then you can open it with gedit
if you open the link that you sent me, you'll see that's not everything
for some reason i can't paste or scroll it all. and can't save it to file
you can if you do 'lspci -v > filename'
http://paste.ubuntu.com/641463/  anyway. i found the cd driver. it's edimax
cd drive? What are you talking about?
i've win driver on a cd
I've better things to do. To me it looks like you're trolling
